ab.title: Numbers 35
ab.l:
And the Lord spoke
to Moses in the steppes of Moab by the Jordan of Jericho, saying,

‘Command the children
of Israel that they give to the Levites of the share
of their possession cities to dwell in, and
you shall give to the Levites pasture lands for the cities all around them.

And
the cities shall be theirs to dwell in, and their pasture lands shall be
for their livestock and for their goods and for all their animals.

And the pasture lands of the cities which you shall give to the Levites
|shall be| from the wall of the city and outward a thousand cubits all around.

And you shall measure from outside the city on the east side
two thousand cubits, and on the south side two thousand
cubits, and on the west side two thousand cubits,
and on the north side two thousand cubits, and the
city shall be in the middle. This shall be to them the pasture lands of the cities.

And the cities which you shall give to the Levites: six
cities of refuge that you shall give for the manslayer to flee there, and
you shall give in addition to them forty-two cities.

All the cities which
you shall give to the Levites: forty-eight cities, them and
their pasture lands.

And the cities which you shall give from the possession
of the children of Israel: from many you shall give many, and from few
you shall give few. Every man shall give from his cities to the Levites according to his share which he takes.’

And the Lord spoke to Moses,
saying,

‘Speak to the children of Israel and say
to them, “When you cross the Jordan to the land of Canaan:

And you shall build you cities: they shall be cities of refuge
for you, and a manslayer who murders a life mistakenly shall flee there.

And they shall be to you cities for refuge
from the avenger, that the manslayer may not die until he stands before
the congregation for judgment.

And of these cities which
you shall give: you shall have six cities for refuge.

You shall give three cities across the ford of Jordan, and three
cities you shall give in the land of Canaan. They shall be cities of refuge.

But if he strikes him with an iron item
so that he dies: he is a murderer.
The murderer shall surely be put to death.

And if he strikes him with a hand stone
by which one could die, and he dies: he is a murderer.
The murderer shall surely be put to death.

Or if he strikes him with a hand
weapon of wood, by which one could die, and he dies: he is a murderer.
The murderer shall surely be put to death.

The avenger
of blood himself shall kill the murderer. When he meets him,
he shall kill him.

And if he
pushes him from enmity or hurls at him
through hunting, and he dies,

Or if in enmity
he strikes him with his hand, and he dies,
the one who struck him shall surely be put to death, he is a murderer: the avenger of blood shall kill
the murderer, when he meets him.

But if
he pushed him suddenly without enmity or cast
on him any item without hunting,

Or
used any item by which one may die seeing him not, and dropped
it on him, and he dies, and he was not his enemy,
and he did not want his harm,

Then
the congregation shall judge between the one who struck
and the avenger of blood according to these judgments.

And the congregation shall rescue the manslayer
from the hand of the avenger of blood, and the congregation shall restore him
to the city of his refuge, where he had fled, and he shall live there
until the death of the high priest, whom one anointed with the holy oil.

But if the manslayer shall indeed go beyond the border of the city
of his refuge, where he had fled,

And the avenger of blood finds him
outside the borders of the city of his refuge, and the avenger of blood murders
the manslayer, he shall not be guilty of blood.

Because he shall live in the city of his refuge
until the death of the high priest, and after the death of the high priest
the manslayer shall return to the land of his possession.

And
these things shall be for a statute of judgment to you throughout your generations
in all your dwelling places.

Anyone who kills a life,
the murderer shall be murdered according to the word of witnesses.
And one witness shall not testify against a person so as to die.

And you shall take no ransom for the life of a murderer, because he
is guilty of death, but he shall be surely put to death.

In the same way, you shall take no ransom from the one
who has to fled to the city of his refuge, that he may return to live
in the land, until the death of the high priest.

And
you shall not defile the land in which you are. Because blood:
it defiles the land, and no atonement can be made for the land
for the blood that is shed in it except by the blood
of the one who shed it.

Do not defile
the land in which you live, in the midst of which my divine Presence
dwells, for I, the Lord, my divine Presence
dwells among the children of Israel.”’
